description: From French ajustement, or else adjust +â€Ž -ment.

entries.meaning: The result of adjusting something; a small change; a minor correction; a modification or alteration
The settling or balancing of a financial account
examples: The credit card company made an adjustment to my account to waive the late fee.

entries.meaning: The behavioural process of balancing conflicting needs, or needs against obstacles in the environment.
examples: When Jim graduated, he found adjustment to the working world difficult.

entries.meaning: The assessment, by an insurance company, of a claim; the settlement of such a claim
